result.execSummary:
All charges against Leanne M. Shelley in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leanne M. Shelley is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

RE: Limited Release of Specific Substance Abuse Treatment Records

1:06 PM Defendant Leanne M. Shelley in court.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Leanne M. Shelley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Longacre states that the trial is a go and asks if there is any video discovery. Attorney Harper states that she put the request in last June. Court states that the witness list and jury instructions are due by 10/07/22. Verdict form due by the end of the week. Court states that jury selection will be on the 19th and trial will begin on the 20th. Attorney Harper speaks about motion to amended the charges.
Minutes from Grant County

Attorney Longacre states that they have received an offer and will not be accepting it. Court sets for jury trial. Attorney Harper asks for a 1 day jury trial.

4:00 PM Defendant Leanne M. Shelley in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Leanne M. Shelley. Attorney Longacre provides the court with the waiver of preliminary hearing. Court reviews it and binds over for trial. 

Court moves forward with the arraignment. Attorney Longacre enters a NG plea on both counts.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:32 AM Defendant Leanne M. Shelley not in court.  Attorney Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Forehand states that LS has called the DA office and COC. LS states that  she qualifies for the public defenders office but wasn't appointed on yet. She was informed by both offices that she is to appear. Attorney Forehand asks for a warrant and stay. Court authorizes but stayed the warrant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:51 AM - Leanne Shelley appears in court. Attorney Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the complaint. LS states that she has a public defender but they aren't able to be here today. Court speaks about the preliminary hearing. Court set the preliminary hearing for 06/20/22 at 4 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:32 AM Defendant Leanne M Shelley in court. Attorney Harper appears in person. LS has received the complaint. Due to computer issues the complaint hasn't been filed yet but will be. Max penalties stated. LS has looked into an attorney and has retained Attorney Anderson. Court sets for a status for the counsel to appear. Attorney Harper comments.

The time for requesting a time a timely preliminary hearing is stayed until June 9, 2022.
Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Harper appears in person. Leanne Shelley appears in custody at RC jail. State asks for a $2,500 signature bond with a no contact condition with RN or that  address. Court orders a $2,500 signature bond with a no contact with RN and her residence.
